page.title: 19ATTITUDES IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: { Commander Goldsmith and Mrs.Graham {have lived in Hambledon all their {lives and here are some of their {thoughts on the changes they have {seen.} There used to be more than the four shops there are in the village now. There was a chemist,three blacksmiths, two bakers,three grocers, a general store,two butchers,three cobblers, three sweet shops,a saddlers, a cycle shop and seven pubs.Everything was so personal in the shops,not like in the supermarket nowadays.You were made to feel important as a customer then. Perhaps the best things to have happened to Hambledon in our lifetimes were the supply of electricity in the 1920's and the quite recent introduction of main drainage!
